USI is dedicated to safeguarding children who are on university-owned or leased property (both on and off campus) and/or who participate in University sponsored child-related programs and activities such as:

  • child care
  • sport camps
  • academic enrichment activities
  • community outreach activities
  • research studies
  • student organizations

The participation of children in these activities requires an increased level of care, and an expectation that individuals will conduct themselves appropriately in the presence of children.

As a host to various groups and activities involving [TERM children]child/minor: a person who is younger than age 18 or who is not emancipated (legally released from the control of parents or guardians)[/TERM], USI developed a [TERM Child Protection Policy]This policy supplements and does not supersede any other legal requirements, for example, child care or teacher licensure.[/TERM] that outlines requirements/conditions associated with:

    • behavioral conduct
    • reporting of violations
    • adult supervision of minors
    • the roles and responsibilities of specific members within the university community
    • protecting university personnel from retaliation
    • sanctions/disciplinary actions of policy violations

[IMG canstockphoto14626474.jpg]

The Child Protection Policy applies to ALL of the following, regardless of the funding source:

  • Employees
  • Students
  • Visitors
  • Volunteers
  • Organizations unrelated to the University that utilize University owned and leased facilities for programs involving children
